11511.content:
"Well, I got this far." you said, rolling your eyes. "I might as well play along."

Mom giggled. "Don't worry, I'll change you back before you have to go back to school." she promised.

"It's Friday afternoon!" you protested. "Are you saying that you're going to keep a girl all weekend!?!"

"Well, you can't expect to learn much magic in just one afternoon." said mom, grinning. "Besides, you look cute this way."

You glared at mom, angry with her, but it got you nowhere so you finally sighed in surrender. "Fine." you said. "Just don't make me all girly."

Mom shook her head. "Sorry, Mat." she said. "You know I do not allow tomboys in this house..."

"No way am I wearing a dress!" you yelled, alarmed.

Mom sighed, patiently. "You will have to, at least, wear a skirt." she said.

"How about a pair of skorts." you suggested, more calmly.

Mom shook her head. "It's either skirts or dresses." she said, firmly. "I can not play favorites." she then frowned. "If you do not pick, I will have to pick for you."

Of course, unknown to you, mom did not want to force you. She was hoping that she could draw out the curious side of you so that you would willingly put on a skirt and, eventually, a dress under your own free will. "What shall it be?"

Knowing that your mom was serious, you let out a low sigh, tearing up. "This is so humiliating!" you whispered.

"A girl wearing a skirt or dress is far from humiliating, Mat." said mom, seriously. "Do you seriously think we girls would wear something that made us feel uncomfortable?"

"I guess not." you said, blushing. "But I have the mind..."

"The mind of a boy, yes, I know." said mom, interrupting. "But this is the only way for you to try your hand at magic."

You weighed the options in your mind then, slowly, reluctantly, nodded. "I'll wear the skirt." you said, finally, grudgingly. "But that's as far as I'll go. I'm trying magic here, not the life of a girl."

"It comes with the package, Mat." countered mom. "By the way, we will need a new name for you while you are a girl."

"A new name?" you asked, looking sick. "What for?"

"Witches have to keep a low profile, Mat." explained mom. "As you said, you had come this far..."

You sighed, again rolling your eyes. "Okay, what did you have in mind?"

"Oh, you want me to pick?" asked mom, grinning. "Thank you!"

You turned white with shock but before you could protest, mom asked, "What do you think about Mary Lucy Harrison?"

"Fine." you said, sighing again. "It's just for the weekend, right?"

"I never break my word, Mat." said mom, smiling. "You will be a boy again before you go back to school."

You shrugged, knowing that there was no out of this now and asked, "So, what do we do first?"

Mom giggled then changed your ill fitting boy's clothing to a skirt and blouse combo. "First, I will..."

"We were all shocked and relieved to discover that it mirrors magic. the only real difference is the requirement of a high tech laboratory to train as the power is science based."

Hannah grinned. "I can't lose in front of my daughters, bro." she whispered.

To you, mom and John were struggling, sending random spells and events, technological spells, all over the room. Fortunately, Julie, being a fully trained witch, had a magical shield up, protecting herself as well as you and Sarah.

"This is getting intense." she whispered. "If they both get angry..."

"The failsafe will be triggered." said Sarah with a moan. "Can you handle two fighting three year olds, Julie?"

Julie shook her head. "My magic is not strong enough to override the failsafe." she said. "We'd have to call either grandma or great aunt Catherine to do it and I doubt they'd be in any hurry."

As you continued to watch with your sisters, mom and John continued to talk. "If he doesn't interfere soon, I'll have to make you my 'little' sister for a while." whispered mom, playfully.

"Well, lets hope he does." replied John, whispering as well. "Otherwise, Megan will never let me live it down."

The duel, as you noticed, escalated even more as mom and John broke free from each others grasp and started to throw more powerful spells. "This is getting out of hand!" you thought, tearing up. "I have to do something!"

1311211111.content:
Making your decision, you ran out from behind Julie's magical shield before she could stop you and fired a weak lightning bolt between uncle John and mom. You were only as powerful as a witch your age, maybe a little more as you had been trained to resist and fight against magic. Still, you were no match for a fully trained witch but the situation demanded you be bold and interfere.

"You two are fighting like a pair of three year olds!" you raged. "Keep it up and you'll trigger the failsafe, making you real three year olds, and we'll all have a mess on our hands!"

"This is not your place, Mat." scolded mom. "Your uncle John and I..."

"Are fighting over my powers!" you interrupted, annoyed. "True, John gave me the lab and the book but it was my choice to study it!" you thought for a moment, then smiled. "Besides, if I was not permitted to have this power, you would have stopped me the second you sensed the ignition of my pseudo magic.... this was test, wasn't it?"

Mom and John smiled. "He got it right off the bat, sis." said John. "His sisters will have their hands full with him."

"Congratulations, Mat." said Mom, giving you a quick hug. "Yes, this was a test to see if you would step in to prevent a rift in the family. The council has deemed you worthy to the title of pseudo witch but, don't fool yourself, more tests will come and they will be harder each time."

"Just like the tests all witches must take." you said, guessing correctly.

Mom nodded. "Where John had to literally fight to become accepted by the council as a pseudo witch, they chose you to have this power." she said. "Though these tests will be more harsh than those given to true witches, you will have it much easier than your uncle did."

"Well, where do we go from here?" you asked.

John grinned in a way that you knew he was going to cause you trouble. "You passed the test but..."

"But what?" you asked, taking a step back.

"You still need to build some resistance to magic." said mom.

Before you could react, Julie, who had lowered her shield, hit you with a spell at mom's silent command and you immediately felt yourself changing. "Mom!" you screamed, alarmed. "This is not fair!"

"Had you kept your guard up, you would have sensed the attack coming, Mat." countered John, smiling. "I learned that lesson the hard way too."

You looked down at yourself and realized, to your horror, that you were becoming...

becoming seven years old and starts to turn into a little girl. her hair gets put into two cute pigtails, and her clothes becomes a pink shirt.
a red skirt, and a pair of white knee high socks and black mary janes,

"Cancel those flames this instant!" she demanded. "I will have no magic wars in this house!" she turned from one 'Sarah' to the other, inwardly pleased with her daughter's self taught skills. "One of you is the real Sarah, who is it?"

"She is!" said Sarah and you, pointing at each other.

Watching, Julie had to hold a hand over her mouth to silence a laugh as mom shifted her weight onto one leg, looking unimpressed. "Well, if I can not tell the two of you apart, I have no choice but to take you both to ballet class."


You moaned loudly as Sarah laughed. "Not ballet!" you protested.

Mom turned to you smiling. "Got you, Mat!"

"What!?" you screamed, your dress now morphing into a ballerina costume. "Mom, please don't!"

Sarah began to laugh louder as a ballerina costume appeared upon herself. "You will love ballet sis!" she said.

Mom stepped forward, smiling, wondering what you would try, then took a firm hold of your hand. "Let's go, young lady." she said, dragging you along. "I'll think up a name for you on the way."

As mom dragged you towards the front door, she winked at Julie who giggled before regressing herself to a seven year old ballerina as well and followed, 'pouting'. "Let's see if Mat plays along or tries to fight back." thought mom, opening the front door. "This should be interesting."

What do you do?
13132.title: Like mother, like daughter.

131322.content:
"This is not fair!" you protested. "I am the victim here, why am I being punished!?" you then pointed at a 'pouting' Julie. "She had nothing to do with this at all, why punish her!?"

"Going to ballet class is hardly a punishment... Mary." said mom, pausing by the opened front door.

Using a power called telekinesis, you closed the door with your mind, causing mom to jump slightly. "Forcing a thirteen year old boy and a sixteen year old girl to look and act like a younger girl is a punishment, mom!" you countered. "Especially with the use of magic!"

Mom frowned, although, inside, she was giggling. "The more magic is used against you, the more resistant you become to it, Mat." she told you. "I'm trying to help you and give you some memorable experiences." she paused. "As for Julie, she can change herself back, if she really tried."

"Asking us first would have been nice!" you fired back. "Let's try this again, shall we?"

With that said, you threw off mom's spell, returning yourself to normal. For a split second, you stood there, completely naked, causing everyone to blush as your normal clothing then appeared onto you. "I have to work on that." you muttered, blushing yourself. "Sorry."

Mom allowed a small grin. "So, you have John's chaotic science." she said.

You nodded. "He gave it to me on my twelfth birthday." you replied. "He told me not to tell anyone about it but I was going to reveal my secret at my birthday party tonight."

Mom then smiled. "I'm glad." she said. "However, I would still like you to give ballet a try, it will bring you closer to your sisters and give you a taste of magic."

You moaned slightly. "Do I have to?" you asked.

Julie giggled. "It's not as bad as you think." she said. "I was in on the joke, though I thank you for sticking up for me, only we will know who you truly are and, as you just proved, you can change yourself back when we return."

You turned to Sarah and saw her eyes, begging you, then sighed. "Alright." you said, grudgingly. "I'll go but this had better not be lame."

Sarah giggled as you were, once again transformed into seven year old Mary in a ballerina costume. "You'll love it!"

Mom then opened the door and ushered you outside. "Let's go... girls." she giggled.

15.content:
You looked around but saw no one. You then paused, listening but heard nothing and shrugged, turning back to the book you had found. Upon seeing what it was, however, your face turned pale. It was a large, thick book with the title, in large bold letters, Chaotic Science. Your uncle John had given it to you in private on your twelfth birthday but you did not fully understand what he meant when you first laid eyes on your book...

"Things happen for a reason, Mat." said John. "That is why I am passing this book on to you."

"Chaotic Science?" you asked. "What is that?"

"Something I have studied, practiced, and perfected during my interesting life." replied John. he then pointed a finger of warning at you. "You must not tell anyone about that book, especially not your grandmother."

"Why not?" you asked.

"Things happen for a reason, Mat." repeated John. Like your sister, Julie, vanishing for a year without a single word of explanation why, right after her thirteenth birthday..."

You became alarmed, swallowing hard. You had an argument with Julie before she had varnished without a trace and secretly blamed yourself for it happening. Dozens of missing persons posters were hung by you, all over town, hoping that someone would know something. Julie did return after a year of absence and you were very relieved and happy to see her back home but she acted as if nothing had happened. She did tell you that it was not your fault and that she appreciated your efforts to 'find' her but it never went passed that. Only you could sense that something about her had changed, it had bothered you since but you could never find any proof.

"You... You mean I'm going to vanish too!?" you asked.

John frowned, you could tell he was holding something back and that scared you deeply. "Study and practice this science well. Mark my words, Mat, it will, someday, save your family."

When you first opened the book, you found instructions to a hidden door in the basement and how to open it. Beyond the door, you found a secret room that extended out, under the back yard. It was fully equipped with everything any scientist could want, including libraries of books on the subject of Chaotic Science. You could only guess then that it had all, somehow, been set up by uncle John. Fearing that you may vanish and returned changed as well, you took your uncle's instructions to heart and began to study the book of chaotic science inside the secret room.

Time passed and you practiced the forbidden sciences, soon developing a love for them. You understood then why you could not tell your family, your mother would have forbid you to study the science any further. Also, you guessed that your grandmother would 'kill' uncle John for giving it to you. Still, you were hooked on it and you were not about to just give it up. Volunteering to do all of the family's laundry after school and on the weekends was a brilliant plan in your mind to practice your new found powers without arousing any suspicion. Unknown to you, that was the same ploy your uncle John had used when he first started.

Now, nearly a year later, you had become quite talented and, after a few very successful experiments, highly intelligent. Only that too came with a price. School became too easy for you and a real pain to endure as you could literally teach the teacher. Fortunately, at home, you found that just being yourself kept any suspicions from rising.

Returning your mind to the present, you looked at your book again, worried. "How could I have been so careless to leave it out in the open!?" you asked yourself quietly. "Someone could have found it and my secret would have been blown!"

Then, a thought came to you and you became alarmed. "Wait a minute... I wouldn't hide my book under a seat cushion!" you whispered, louder. you then gasped. "Someone knows!"

Then you heard someone clear their throat and you shot your eyes up to find...
15.title: Someone knows!

choices: Mom walks in on you both.
151.content:
You shot your eyes up to find Julie, in her school uniform, holding a book of her own. "I always wondered why you had kept yourself so distant over the past year." she said, seriously. "It was almost as if you had... vanished."

Thinking back, you began to feel guilty. "I... I guess I was a bit of a loner for a while." you said. "It was not intentional. I couldn't tell anyone about this." you paused. "May i assume you are the one who found my book?"

Julie nodded. "I found it." she said. "Which is the only reason I am showing this to you." she handed you her book. "This is the reason I had to vanish for a year, the same reason you had to."

You looked at Julie shocked, then opened the book to examine it's pages. As you did, your face turned an ashen white, seeing that the two books were nearly identical with the exception that your book explained everything in technical terms while the 'magic book', as it was entitled, explained things more poetically.

"How... How is this possible?" you asked, turning back to Julie. "Did uncle John somehow mimic magic with science?"

"You're close." replied Julie. "Your great uncle Jack found a way to do that then passed his knowledge and power onto uncle John when he turned 12... without permission." she suddenly smiled. "Uncle John perfected that science and passed it on to you, most likely on your 12th birthday."

"Just as it was passed onto him." you mused. "But did uncle John ask permission?"

Julie shrugged. "I don't know." she replied honestly. "When I first discovered your secret, my first instinct was to tell mom but I decided not to until I talked to you about it."

"Uncle John made me promise not to tell anyone, especially not grandma." you said, wincing. "I decided to tell everyone tonight, at my 13th birthday party."

"Then I'll let you tell mom yourself." said Julie, slightly relieved. "I am sorry I could not tell you that I was a witch, Mat but, you see, only girls can use magic. Boys do have the potential but it lies dormant, unusable unless you are turned into a girl or..."

"...Or it begins to sleepwalk, giving them the ability to throw waves of sheer will, similar to a witch's power blast." you finished. "Another way is to gain chaotic science." you grinned. "Uncle John outlined all of that in chapter two of the book he gave me."

Julie looked at you for a moment, then giggled. "Then, I assume you also know all of the laws a witch must follow."

You nodded. "Chapter eight; Laws of super science and witchcraft."

"It looks like uncle John covered everything great uncle Jack did not." said Julie. "do you also have a hologram teacher?"

Again, you nodded. "Hologram John." you replied. "He's a little more serious than uncle John but he's still fun."

Julie nodded, understanding. "Well, until tonight, this will be our little secret." she told you. "But, um... could you do one little favor for me?"

You sensed a trap and rose your hand in defense. "I don't want to be a girl." you warned, silently.

Julie laughed. "Not that, bro!" she laughed. "I just want to see your laboratory, that's all." she then paused. "That and maybe have a practice duel with you, just to see how good you are with that science."

You smiled at the prospect of testing yourself against your older sister and nodded. "You are on, with one condition."

"What's that?" asked Julie, curious.

"Power blasts only, no spells." you demanded. "I don't want mom to sense a duel and ground us both for fighting."

Julie smiled, seeing your logic. "Agreed." she said.
151.title: Our little secret.

1511.content:
You led Julie down to the basement where you stood in front of the wall, facing the back yard. It was your dad's work station before he had passed away. You shed a single tear, thinking of him and wished he could see you now before stating the command phrase to open the door. "Tamami!"

The shelves on the wall moved aside and the wall behind it slid down, into the floor, revealing a large, well lit chamber beyond, which you entered with Julie quickly following. Once the door closed behind you, she looked at you, curious.

"Tamami?" she asked.

You shrugged. "I am Mat, said backwards." you replied. Julie giggled to which you asked, "Would you have guessed it?"

Julie shook her head. "Never." she replied. then she turned to your laboratory and her jaw dropped. "Woah!"

You smiled at her reaction. "This is where I had been spending most of my time during the past year." you said. "Only, John told me that I am at the level of a pseudo witch but I still need training."

Looking around, feeling as if she had been pulled into a high budget science fiction movie with countless of high tech equipment that she could only guess did what. Julie had seen uncle John's laboratory at grandma's house but this one was far more advanced. Then, she saw a full holographic image of uncle John approaching her.

"Good day, Julie." he said. "Welcome to Mat's laboratory." he then turned to Mat. "I thought you had planned not to tell your family until your birthday party this evening."

"I was practicing reveal spells in the living room and accidentally summoned Mat's book." explained Julie, defending you. "Mom does not know, I confronted Mat alone and asked him to show me his laboratory."

John turned back to Julie. "I understand." he said. "Would you like to participate in Mat's final test?"

"What kind of test?" asked Julie.

John smiled. "A duel."

"We were planning just that." you said. "Julie wants to see how strong I had become."

Two round platforms rose from the floor and lit up before you and your sister took your positions, facing each other in a dueling posture. "The rules are simple." said John. "Energy blasts only, the first to knock the other off their platform will win the duel... begin!"

Julie started first with a powerful energy blast, not wanting to go easy on you, but you managed to dodge it and fire one of your own as she fired again. Back and forth for nearly twenty minutes, you and Julie exchanged blows with you, soon after, sweating and gasping for breath. You sister seemed relentless but you had your mom's iron will and fired one last powerful blast, hoping it would throw her off her platform. Only, to your shock, she caught your blast and threw it right back, giggling, "Catch!"

You were out of breath and on the verge of passing out but you managed to catch it and weakly throw it back before falling from your platform, no longer able to stand. Only to your surprise, Julie was there to catch you with hologram John, watching over you, smiling.

"Congratulations, Mat." said John. "You have proven yourself powerful enough to hold your own against a witch with a year of training, I am very proud of you."

"Did I win?" you asked.

Julie winced slightly. "Sorry, Mat, you lost." she said. "Don't feel bad, though, I have three years of training over you." she then smiled. "Despite that, you really made me work for that win, I'm impressed."

"Mat still requires training." said John to Julie. "When your uncle John was trained by Jack, he gained five years of training in one year, making him very formidable against even adult witches." he frowned. "However, this also caused John several porblems among the witching world."

"How so?" asked Julie.

"Would you be worried if a 13 year old girl suddenly gained the power of an adult witch?" asked John. "Take that fear and and the fact that the witch is a boy, someone who is not supposed to have 'magic' at all."

Julie shivered that the thought. "I see your point." she said.

"John has been teaching me gender spells." you told Julie. "That way, I can practice in the open after my birthday and everyone, who knows, will think it was magic."

"John's mother felt robbed and betrayed as Jack had trained him instead of her." said 'John'. "Therefore, I had been programed to only train Mat to the point where he can defend himself and allow his mom to continue his training."

You turned to John, hurt. "Does this mean..."

"No, I will always be here to guide and protect you, Mat." said John. "I am merely opening the door for your mother to participate in your training."

You smiled at that.

Later on...
1511.title: You show Julie your laboratory.

15113.content:
You and Julie parted shortly after leaving your laboratory and went about your normal routines. You did your homework, faster than usual, to which mom insisted upon looking it over. After confirming all of the answers were correct, she turned to you, curious. "Normally, you struggle with your homework." she said. "What's different today?"

"I want everything perfect today." you replied. "I plan on asking Jenny out on a date tonight."

Mom smiled. "So you're finally going to admit you have a crush on her." she said. "It's about time."

You blushed at that, causing mom to giggle. "I'm sure tonight will be full of surprises." she said.

"You have no idea." you thought, smiling back.

Just then, the doorbell rang and mom excused herself to answer. You followed her down the stairs to the front door where you saw that aunt Hayley had arrived with her husband Paul along with aunt Mel with her husband Harry. Behind them all were your cousins. Stephanie(7), Katherine(14), and Jack(13) from Hayley's family and Kelsey(14), Gina(8), and twin brother and sister Jessica and James (both 13) from Mel's family.

"It's good to see you all again." said mom, giving her two sisters a warm hug. "I'm glad you could come to the party." she paused. "Where is John, Megan, and their kids?"

Hayley giggled. "John's eight year old son, Hank, got into a little mischief." she replied. "Megan and her twin thirteen year old daughters, Jane and Joann, gave their 'little sister' some makeup tips."

Mom smiled, knowing that John's only son had either discovered a magic book or stumbled upon his father's laboratory, resulting in him becoming transformed into a young girl. Only you, visualizing the same thing, stifled a laugh, catching your mom and aunts' attention. "They gave Hank a makeover!?" you asked, still chuckling. "That's funny!"

Hayley smiled, thinking you would not be laughing after you are told the truth about magic. "It's not nice to laugh at other people's expense, Mat." she warned lightly. "I learned that myself the hard way, you could be next."

You stopped laughing, remembering that you were out gunned when it came to magic. "You're right, aunt Hayley." you said, pouting slightly. "I'm sorry."

"Mat wants to ask Jenny out at his birthday party tonight." said mom, still unaware. "It's going to be an interesting night."

Hayley and Mel nodded in agreement, not yet knowing you had a few surprises of your own planned for the party.
15113.title: Your aunts arrive.

151132.content:
Then a loud car horn was heard and all looked to see a that John was arriving in his 'concept model' car. Hayley shook her head and giggled. "He still loves to make a dramatic entrance." she said. "What a show off."

http://worldislandparadise.com/wp-conten...

Upon parking the car, Megan came out first with her two daughters, Jane and Joan. Both twins had quite a figure, just like their mother, with honey blond hair and blue eyes. They both smiled, waving at their aunts and cousins, as they dragged a reluctant little girl behind them. She was blushing brightly, wearing a pink princess dress with white stockings and black mary janes. Her face was covered with a light amount of make up and her hair was in braids. You struggled not to laugh as you saw her shaking her head, begging to return to the car.

"Hey, aunt Hayley." said Jane, pulling her new sister in front of her. "Say hello to our new sister, Holly."

"Aw, you're so cute!" cooed Hayley, smiling.

Holly teared up, her lips trembling. It reminded Hayley of her brother, John when she first transformed him into a little girl. "Please, aunt Hayley..." she begged, "I'm not a girl and they won't change me back."

"What did she do?" asked Mel, smiling at her new niece.

Joan giggled. "Hank got a pet frog, he called Igor, from uncle Tim for his birthday last week." she explained. "Well, he decided that Igor would like jumping around in my closet."

Jane giggled. "Only, that's where Joan hid her magic book and Hank found it." she said, smiling. "He put the frog back into his pocket and opened the book, triggering the trap."

Megan smiled. "John has been rather protective of his little girls." she said. "Searching their rooms at random for boys hiding in the closet or under the bed." she giggled. "Being a witch myself now, I set up a trap to change John into a girl as Joan often used her magic book to hide her diary."

"I never thought John would be that protective." mussed Hayley, surprised.

Megan sighed. "Witch boys are still coming to our house, begging to be trained in chaotic science." she explained. "John only looks to see if the magic seal on the diary had not been tampered with, he does not read it." she then smiled. "However, he needed to be reminded that girls need their privacy."

"Only Hank is learning that lesson instead." said mom with a wicked grin. "Sounds familiar."

Your aunts all giggled as Holly moaned. "Aunt Melanie... Aunt Hannah?" she asked, trying.

Mom shook her head. "Sorry... Holly." she giggled. "Being a little girl for a while won't hurt you and besides, changing you back is up to your sisters, not us."

Just then John came into view. Looking at him, you smiled. He was a powerfully built man with longish brown hair and blazing hazel eyes. You were surprised to see him in a suit, rather than he usual lab coat and casual clothing. "Happy birthday, Mat!" he said with a slightly booming voice. "I have a feeling this party will be remembered for quite a while."

He then turned to his sisters, hugging them all in turn before shaking hands with each of their husbands. "It's been a while since the family has been together like this." he said. "What do you say to some childhood fun tonight?"

You looked at uncle John confused and concerned as your aunts all smiled. "Only who will be watching over us kids?" asked mom, a twinkle in her eyes. "Someone has to stay an adult."

John laughed, shaking the room. "Why who else but..."
151132.title: Uncle John arrives.

1511322.content:
"Who else but our mom?" he asked, smiling at Natalie who had appeared in the room. "It will be like old times and we can show our kids how we played at their age."

Natalie laughed. "I don't mind being a little younger for a while." she said. "However, I can't watch over so many youngsters alone. I'm going to need some help."

With that, she pulled a cell phone from her dress pocket and dialed a number. Who did she call...?
1511322.title: Our mom. (Natile Harrison)

152.content: "Hi Mat" Sarah says, "Can you play a game with me?" She asks, "Fine okay" you say, "So what do you want to play?" You ask, "Let's play...
152.title: Sarah, wanting to play.

1522.content:
"Let's play pretend." suggested Sarah, smiling.

"Pretend, huh?" you asked. "What do you have in mind?"

Sarah giggled. "Let's pretend that I know your secret and you have to change yourself into my little sister for the rest of the night if you don't want me telling mommy."

You smiled at Sarah, making her suddenly nervous. "How about we pretend that you don't remember anything about my book and go play like a good little girl."

Sarah pouted, then let out a low scream as she saw a small glowing ball fire at her from your hand. Only she was quick to recover and held up her own hand, causing your 'event', or technological spell, to harmlessly hit an invisible shield.

"Surprise, bro!" she said, giggling. "I am a witch, all of the girls in this family are but boys are not." she then laughed. "Then again, it seems they 'can' work this chaos science."

You frowned. "That's chaotic science." you said. "Only, from where I stand, you are in more trouble than me."

"How so?" asked Sarah, still grinning. "Mom will be mad, knowing that you are playing around with that stuff."

You smile sis not falter. "She will be more angry, knowing that you are teaching yourself this 'magic'." you said. "As for myself, I have a holographic instructor helping me learn and grow."

"Become my little sister or I'll scream for mommy." demanded Sarah, growing impatient.

"Go ahead, holler your head off." you challenged. "I'll just use a bio-electromechanical phase modification to alter my appearance to that of a little girl and blame you for it, saying you mentioned something about magic."

Sarah looked at you, confused. "What?"
1522.title: Who is blackmailing who?

choices: Just tell her its your book.
154.content:
Grandma gave you a kind smile then glanced at the book, still in your hands, and gave you a slightly concerned look before quickly hiding it, still smiling. "Hello, Mat." she said, kindly. "How was school?"

"It was okay, grandma." you said, trying to sound natural. "You know, hitting the books, chatting with friends..."

"I can see you're hitting the books." said Natalie. "But, something tells me that you didn't get that book from school." she smiled patiently, wondering how you were going to react. "Where did you get that book?"

You began to panic as you knew uncle John did not want you to tell grandma that he gave you the book, at least not until your thirteenth birthday, and made it vanish while she was looking you in the eye. "Um... what book, grandma?" you asked, looking innocent.

Natalie giggled on the inside. "Nice try, Mat." she thought. she then caused the book to reappear in your hands, forcing a short scream to escape your lips. "That book." she said.

"Oh, this book." you said, giving a low nervous laugh.

Natalie smiled, she had seen all of the tricks and had heard all of the excuses. She had expected you to quickly replace your chaotic science book with some science fiction novel but you surprised her when you replied, "I found it under the seat cushion?"

"The seat cushion, you say?" asked Natalie, hiding her amusement. "That is a silly place to put a book, who do you think it belongs to?"

You felt trapped, you did not want to give up your book, you had learned so much in such a short time. Still, you did not want to get anyone in trouble, especially not your uncle John. "What am I going to do!?" you thought.

"Mat?" asked Natalie, looking more concerned. "Are you okay? You look a little pale."

What do you do?
154.title: Grandma, concerned.

1543.content:
Your eyes watered as you slowly shook your head. "I can't tell you." you sobbed. "I promised..."

"You promised what to who, Mat?" asked Natalie, calmly.

Natalie hated to press her grandson but it was necessary to test his loyalty to the safety of his family. "Mat..."

You began to sob. "Lying is forbidden in his house, grandma." you said, now shaking. "I... I can't break a promise either, what should I do?"

"Did you promise not to tell who asked you to keep this secret?" asked Natalie, trying another approach.

You paused, thinking back, then shook your head. "No, I didn't."

Natalie nodded then leaned in close. "Just between us." she said. "Who asked you to keep this secret?"

You swallowed hard then whispered, "Uncle John."

Natalie sighed. "Your uncle gave you his chaotic science?" she asked.

"Please don't ask me!" you begged, sobbing. "I told you who made me promise, I... I don't want to get anyone in trouble!"

"No one is in trouble, Mat." said Natalie, giggling. "You see, this was test."

You were surprised. "A... A test?" you asked. "Why?"

"Loyalty must be tested, Mat." said Natalie. "John passed his test by asking me, the witch council, and your mother before passing his knowledge on to you." she paused, giggling at your shocked expression. "Yes, your mom knows, but your two sisters don't."

"How was this a test for me?" you asked, curious.

Natalie smiled. "I took your book from its original hiding place inside the coffee table and planted it under the cushion of your favorite chair for you to find." she explained. "I had John make you promise not to tell anyone, especially not me, to test if you would honor your promise." she giggled. "You passed."

You sighed, relieved. "So, what happens now?" you asked.

"Well, first off, in case you had not yet noticed, I am a witch." replied Natalie. "So is your mother, your aunts, your girl cousins, and your sisters." she paused, smiling. "Only girls can work magic, boys in witch families can not unless they are transformed into a girl around the age of thirteen."

You shivered at the thought as, like your uncle John, you were a fan of science fiction. "I can think of a few unpleasant things they could do to me." you said. "I hope they don't though."

Natalie chuckled. "Your uncle John had the very same fears when he discovered our magic book."

You looked at Natalie, confused. "Magic book?" you asked.

Smiling, Natalie produced a book, just as thick as your own, and handed it to you. "Compare this to your own book, Mat." she told you. "Note that they are practically identical."

You opened the magic book and was immediately bombarded by an eerie light. Natalie knew what it was but said nothing as your chaotic science made you completely safe from its effects. As you flipped through the pages, your face turned a familiar ashen white.

"That was John's expression when he discovered magic." thought Natalie. "Only, Mat will have it much easier, he is not a twin to a witch."

"This... This is impossible!" you whispered, to Natalie's giggling. "My science is a technological version of magic itself!"

"Correct, Mat." said Natalie, producing a much smaller book. "Now, I need you to study this."

"What is it?" you asked.

"Pseudo magic is a science so advanced, it becomes magic." explained Natalie. "Your chaotic science is equal to magic, therefore, you are a pseudo witch."

After flipping through the pages of the smaller book, you turned to Natalie, serious. "These are the laws I am expected to follow as a young pseudo witch, right?"

Natalie nodded. "You are basically expected to follow the same laws as a witch as well as any rules your mother might impose upon your use of your science while in the house, at school, or where ever."

Just then, mom walked in with a warm smile on her face. "Well done, Mat." she said, giving you a warm hug. "I'm very proud of you for keeping your promise without directly lying."

"You knew about my studies all along?" you asked, looking somewhat downcast.

Mom giggled, releasing you. "Don't take it so hard, Mat." she said. "Even if John had not asked permission, I would have sensed that power within you the instants you began to harness it."

"I see." you said.

"I'm not going to take this science away form you, Mat." assured mom, kindly. "But I am going to enforce the same rules upon you as I do your sisters and I am going to expect you to follow them."

You slowly nodded. "Yes, mom." you said.

Mom smiled, rubbing her hand in your hair. "Relax!" she giggled. "Sarah and Julie don't know yet. I want to see their reactions to your power."

"So do I." replied Natalie, before she laughed. "When are you going to 'tell' Mat and Sarah that magic is real?"

"Just as soon as Julie brings Sarah back from ballet class.." she said. she then turned to you. "Want a few lessons?"

You quickly shook your head before smiling. "Only if Sarah asks me nicely." you replied. "Otherwise, no way."

Mom and Natalie slowly nodded at each other then smiled at you. "Deal." they said in unison.

You took a step back at that, not knowing what to expect. Minutes later, Julie returned with Sarah to find mom waiting for them in the living room with Natalie and Mat. "Please come sit down." said mom. "I have something very important to discuss with all of you."

Julie did well to hide her smile as she knew what she wanted to talk about, as it was your thirteenth birthday. Sarah had a small grin on her face and you suspected she already knew as you could sense a power emitting from her. Once your sisters had sat down, mom explained the family secret, that all of the girls in their family were witches and that boys do not have this power, unless they are transformed into girls. She told them that boys are usually more muscular and athletic, using their uncle John's Tia Chi and athletics as an example. Only, she made no mention of the fact that you were a pseudo witch.

"Do not be overzealous when you use your magic against Mat." warned mom. "I know from experience that doing so brings dire consequences..."

"Like what?" asked Julie, knowing well what but playing along.

"You will find out, if you go too far with Mat." said mom, serious. "Remember my warning."

How do your sisters react?
1543.title: Please don't ask me!

choices: You pre empt, taking the girls by surprise
the girls use their powers first
15433.content:
Both your sisters grin. Julie goes first. "Hey, Mat. Could you do me a favor. The squad needs a new member, and I..."

"No. I want to play dress up with Mat" Sarah whines.

'Here we go. They're already squabbling about what to turn me into. Don't they care that I don't want to be turned into a girl" you think to yourself, as you watch both sisters summon flames, with Julie's significantly stronger. From John's notes, you know magic is draining, and that Sarah would only be able to cast a spell or two before going for an early nap. Julie would be more aof a problem, since you have no idea of her strength, but you figure you can win, if you take her out quickly. If it becomes a magic/science exchange, she has you outgunned.

"Guess what I can do, and you can't" Sarah says, holding a pink magic spell in her hand. You guess what she has in mind, and you're furious.
15433.title: Sarah and Julie have some 'fun'.

154331.content:
"That's not going to happen, Sarah!" you said, annoyed, firing a bolt at her. "I'm not helpless!"

The bolt was a sleep wave, a harmless energy blast that carried a subliminal message to the brain to sleep. The bolt his Sarah and she immediately crumbled to the floor, fast asleep. You then turned to Julie but, as you had suspected, she was more experienced and easily dodged your attack and fired a bolt right back. It hit, leaving you unable to move as you fell to the floor like a stiff board. Julie was on top of you in the next breath.

"Uncle John passed his science onto you, I see." she said, smiling. "I don't blame you for defending yourself against Sarah but I did nothing to warrant an attack and I can't have you going after people without reason, you must be punished."

You sat, there, unable to move or defend yourself and watched in horror as Julie took out a small bottle and poured its contents down your throat. "What will that do to him?" asked mom.

Julie turned to mom and smiled. "It's nothing permanent, mom." she promised. "The potion will wear off in a few weeks but until then, he will be a girl about..."
154331.title: You pre empt, but you get the surprise.

choices: The next day, You don't go back to being Mary
1543311.content:
"I thought you needed someone to help you on the cheer squad." said Natalie, smiling.

Julie shook her head. "I need willing help, Natalie." she replied, seriously. "I can't have a cheerleader is going to whine and complain all the time, its not good for moral."

"So, I get a playmate for a while?" asked Sarah, hopeful.

"I doubt 'Mary' will be in the mood to play for a while, Sarah." replied mom with a sigh. "However, if she can apologize for her attack on Julie and if she accepts it, I might allow her to use the ECE serum for 'his' birthday party tonight."

"ECE serum?" asked Sarah, lost.

"Emergency Counter Effect serum." said Julie. "Its the equivalent to the all cancellation potion."

"Oh." said Sarah, still lost.

"It'll change me back to normal." you said, finally able to move again. you then turned back to Julie. "I'm very, truly sorry I attacked you, sis. I got mad and overreacted, will you forgive me?"

Julie looked into your eyes and saw that your apology was sincere and slowly nodded. "I forgive you." she said. "However, you still need to learn to control yourself when yielding such power."

"I agree." said mom, seriously. "Neither magic or science should be used as a toy. Sarah needs to learn this as well so Matt, starting tomorrow, you will be seven year old Mary for a week for your loss of temper."

You sighed, knowing it was pointless to argue. "Yes, mom." you replied.

Mom smiled. "It won't be so bad." she said. "The experience will be good for you." she then turned to Sarah. "As for you, young lady, its not nice to tease your brother with magic. You will be spending a day as a boy, starting tomorrow."

"What!?!" screamed Sarah, in tears. "A whole day!?!"

Mom frowned. "Do you want me to make it a week?"

Sarah pouted, tears falling. "No."

"Enough seriousness." said Natalie. "Its time for Matt to enjoy his birthday."

Mom nodded. "I agree." she said, turning to you. "You may now change yourself back but remember, no lab for a week after this as you need to stay a girl for that time."

You nodded then ran off as mom and Natale giggled. "This brings back wonderful memories." she said. "I remember when your bother spent his first week as a girl during his retraining."

"Retraining?" asked Julie.

Natalie nodded. "You see, word of John's power rattled the witch world as then only girls had real power." she said. "Elvira, your great grandmother, had to act quickly to appease them."

Julie nodded. "I remember now." she said. "John spent a year at witch school, learning magic, while he talked about his chaotic science. It was explained in a special class that they mirror each other."

Mom grinned. "They mirror each other but they are not the same." she said. "Only witch boys can work pseudo magic while only girls can work real magic, its a balance."

"So what now?" asked Sarah, seeing you return in your male form.

Mom and Natalie looked at each other and nodded.
1543311.title: seven years old.

15433112.content: The next day, You wake up unchanged and head downstairs and see a male Sarah. Mom asks "why didn't you become Mary again?" "I created a serum to keep me male without being changed by magic" you say, "You broke your promise Mat" mom says "yeah but I have my reasons" you say. "Tell me so I can help" mom says "you have to find out yourself" you say, "by"
15433112.title: The next day, You don't go back to being Mary

choices: Sarah; You become a 7 year old balerina.
154332.content:
Sarah threw her spell at you, much to Julie's annoyance, unaware that you were more than just annoyed. As the pink colored energy ball came closer, your face hardened and you rose your hand to stop it.

Sarah grinned, "That won't save you..."

Only her words died in her throat as her spell hit an invisible wall, just beyond your outreached hand. "Sorry, siblings." you said, furious, lowing your hand. "I have powers of my own!"

Julie and Sarah turned to you, shocked, then screamed as you summoned a pyrokinetic flame to your hand. It was not as strong as Julie's magic flame but strong enough to hold your own. You grinned at their shocked expressions then canceled your flame, turned, and walked away. As you slowly walked towards the basement stairs, you kept your senses on high alert of any magical attacks. Mom and Natalie both had shocked looks on their faces as well, knowing that it was an act made you grin more.

"How did you do that!?" demanded Julie, sounding concerned. "Only uncle John could..." you turned to her with a sly grin on your face and she turned pale. "Oh, crap! He didn't...!"

"He did." you replied. "I have nearly a full year of training."

You did not tell them that you were not as powerful as you had hoped to be. Your uncle John was a twin to a witch, creating a magical balance that made it easy for him to learn and develop his science quickly. As you had no twin sister, you had to work extra hard to grasp the fundamentals of chaotic science. However, like your mom, you had a steel determination and became just as powerful as any witch your own age. When John first started, he was as powerful as any witch with one year of training... and beyond.

Sarah seemed confused. "Uncle John did what?" she asked, turning between Julie and you. "What did he do?"

"Uncle John is a pseudo witch, Sarah." replied Julie, explaining. "That means he has a science, equal to magic."

Sarah was shocked. "Uncle John, a boy, a witch!?"

Mom laughed. "Yes, Sarah, my brother is a chaotic scientist." she said. "The witching world had dubbed him a pseudo witch, or like a witch."

"Okay." said Sarah, slowly. "So, he's like a witch." she shrugged, "Why did he give this power to Mat?"

"John's son, Joe, is too young, right now." replied Natalie with a sigh. "That, and he's a known girl taunter."

"Joe doesn't hate girls." protested Sarah, lightly. "He just likes to mess with our heads."

"Just like a certain sister in law I know." thought Natalie. "Joe is not ready for that power, science or magic."

"I agree your cousin, Joe is not a girl hater." said mom, patiently. "However, he takes his jokes too far and punishments from both magic and science don't seem to detour him."

Mom thought about John, he had married Megan Thompson and had four kids. Jessie (14) fresh out of witch school, she had long honey blond hair and green eyes. Lucy (13) with long honey blond hair and blue eyes. She just found out about magic and is eager to play with Joe. Jenna, (7) also having the same hair color and style, does not know about magic but carries a 'certain talent' that she keeps quiet... feels like a freak, making her very shy. Joe (8) short brown hair and very strong, has a love for anything that builds his muscle mass. He taunts girls, just for fun, but does not know when to quit.

"The point is, John passed on his science to a boy he and the council believed deserved it." said Natalie, reeling mom from her thoughts. "All of his closest aunts have girls in their family who will, no doubt, want to play with him as well, when they come visit."

"Think of this as a challenge, kids." said mom, smiling. "Mat has the power to fight back but, he is still learning."

"Can we still play with him?" asked Sarah.

You suddenly smiled. "Only if you ask nicely." you replied. "Also, I have the power to change myself back... and change all of you, please do not force that."

Julie nodded. "I won't go too far with you, Mat." she said. "I promise.

"I just want to play with you." said Sarah, tearing up.

"That's fine." you told her. "I don't mind helping either of you but I will not allow you take anything too far."

Mom and Natalie turned to each other, smiling, they were up to mischief. "so, Mat." said mom, smiling. "Who would you like to play with first?"

"A blind man in New Jersey could have seen that one coming." you thought sarcastically.

"The squad is really in a bind, Mat." said Julie, wincing. "Could you please help your big sis out." she paused. "I've been given a few lessons in chaotic science at witch school, maybe I can help you get stronger."

"I just want to have someone to play with for a few hours." said Sarah, competing with her older sister. "You always told me that you wanted to be more flexible, like Uncle John, ballet will teach that."

You turned from Julie to Sarah, wondering what to do as mom and Elvira silently giggled in the background. They knew that you would fight against a magical experience so they had to trick you into one. "At least they are leaving me with a choice." you thought. "As little choice as it is..."

Who do you decide to help first?
154332.title: the girls use their powers first

1543321.content:
"Two questions, Julie." you said. "How long will I have to be a girl on your cheer squad and how old are you planning to make me for that time period?"

"You would on the squad for no more than a week as my cousin, Madeline." replied Julie, serious. "Also, you would be sixteen, same as me, just not my twin as too many things can go wrong if I did that." she paused, seeing your reluctance. "You will be back to being 13 year old Mat the night before your birthday, I swear it."

"You already have beyond college level intelligence, Mat." said mom, grinning. "Fitting in should be a breeze as long as you keep in mind that you are a teenage girl."

"Julie just wants her squad in that stupid cheer leading competition." said Sarah, pouting. "They're one cheer leader shy of entering and Julie knows that your love for dance makes you a good choice."

"Well, duh!" replied Julie. "I won't be asking him if I didn't think he could pull it off." she turned to you. "The winner of the competition gets awarded a huge grant for their school for upgrades on uniforms, books, science labs..."

Sarah began to pout, she knew that she could not compete with that but she still gave one last try. "Ballet teaches more than flexibility, Mat." she said. "It also teaches patience, discipline, and balance."

You sighed at your younger sister then turned to Julie. "You know that lying is forbidden in this house, Julie." you said. "Do I have your word that you will return me to my rightful age and gender on the evening on the eve of my birthday?"

"You have my word I will return you to your rightful age and gender on the night of the eve of your birthday." replied Julie, seriously. "I never break my word."

"Do you also promise to help me with my science when this is over?" you asked, more calmly.

Julie nodded. "As promised, I and mom will help you." she said.

You sighed once more then slowly nodded. "I'm in."

Julie smiled. "Welcome to the squad... Madeline." she said. "I will transform you in the morning, before you shower, so you will have time to set up a story for your absence."

How does Sarah react?
1543321.title: Julie; You become a cheerleader.

15433212.content:
For a moment, Sarah looked as if she was about to fall into a bratty tantrum but she instead sighed, heavily, tearing up as she sat down. "I can wait, I guess." she said. "It's only a week."

Feeling sorry for her, as you had your mom's heart, you walked over to Sarah and sat down next to her. "I heard that your ballet class will be looking for new students for their annual recital next week." you said. "Wouldn't it be better if I help you as one of those students?"

Sarah looked at you, nearly crying. "But, it takes two weeks to get ready for that recital." she said.

"I will be spending two weeks with Jule." you countered. "One week as a cheer leader and one week as a rising pseudo witch, that will make you and your sister even, right?"

Mom nodded, pleased that you were so willing to help your sisters, despite losing your manhood for nearly a month. "I am very pleased that you are taking Mat's decision so well, Sarah." she said. "As a reward, I will ask Mat to be your seven year old cousin until bed time."

"What!?" you asked , shocked.

Mom grinned at you. "I am not ordering you, Mat." she said, with a mischievous look. "I am asking you."

Sarah looked at you hopefully as Julie suppressed a giggle. "Not very sporting, mom." she thought. "But very funny."

You sighed. "Why me?" you asked.

"I'll tell you what." said Natalie, grinning herself. "Why don't you have a friendly duel with Sarah?"

"A duel?" you asked, nervous.

"That's a great idea." said mom. she then turned to you. "If you win, you stay as Mat until tomorrow morning, if you lose, you become Sarah's little cousin until tomorrow."

What do you say?
15433212.title: Well (is rewarded by mom.)

154332121.content: "Okay. I agree." You say, "But first" Your mom says, "I'm going to call an old friend and ask her about her son." She adds, after a few hours, Mom comes back with a boy your age with short black hair wearing a simple red shirt with the silhouette of a phoenix on it and a pair of blue jeans he's also wearing sneakers. "This is Jake. My friend Tina's son they know of magic as Tina and her daughter Lily are witches aswell, and I invited Jake because he has taught himself some magic somehow." She adds, "Actually Mrs. C, it's actually a special kind of chi that few males possess. It's like Chaotic Science, only it mimics magic even more so than Chaotic Science due to it actually waking the male's inner magical roots up quite a bit to where some of a Witch's spell can be used without it affecting the physical body to alter the genes." Jake says before adding, "As such, I can use the chi whether I'm male or female. It just isn't pure magic. So if the battle gets way out of hand, I can interrupt a duel if it becomes too dangerous, to where even your own mother could get hurt due to the duel." "Wow. I didn't even know that was possible, as it was never mentioned in Uncle John's book" You say surprised. "That is because Mat, It hadn't happened around the time he gave you the book. Only at that time, it was between two witches that're sisters, And the spells got so out of hand, That their mother who tried to interfere the slow it down almost ended up having her brain get damaged trying to block the blasts." He says. "Well, thanks dude." You say before you notice Sarah is staring at Jake with eyes that you recognized as the eyes of someone who's been struck by Cupid's arrow. (News from the the author. "The interruption option will be heading far into crossing over with Power Rangers, as the original version of this chapter went differently where Jake was named Nick and he's the Mystic Force Red Ranger. So, if you want to stay in The New Witch storyline with no crossover, just click "The Duel Begins" Option when it has a chapter made for that option that is. But if you want to see the essence of The New Witch's world crossing into Power Rangers, Just click the, "Interruption" Option. And sorry if the this chapter isn't making much sense to the logic you're probably used to from Runner's story. I just couldn't come up with a better idea for why Mat's mom wanted Jake/Nick to come over for the duel.)
154332121.title: You agree.

1543321212.content:
Before the duel between you and Sarah could begin, Nick's cellphone went off and he immediately answered. "Hello?"

"Sorry cut your visit to mom short, Nick." said the voice on the other line. "We need you to come back to Briarwood as soon as you can, Octomus and his minions are hitting the town hard, it looks bad."

Nick sighed. "I can't even spend a few hours with mom anymore." he whispered, tearfully. then he said, "I'm on my way!" he placed his cellphone away then turned to mom. "I got to go, Ms Powers."

"I understand, Nick." said mom with a sympathetic tone. "Duty calls."

"Wait, what is this all about!?" you asked concerned. "Who is this Octomus?"

Mom sighed and placed a hand onto your head. "This will be faster than telling you." she said.

Instantly, information flooded your mind...

Twenty years ago, in a magic-filled dimension parallel world to your own, the forces of darkness came into power and a war called the "Great Battle" between good and evil began. An army of the Mbahgwie, led by a powerful warrior named Morticon, swarmed into the land with their sights set on taking over the magical realm, the human realm and beyond, but they would have to combat a legion of brave and powerful wizards. The Mystics battled valiantly against overwhelming odds until they drove the evil back from the edge of the human world. The strongest wizard of all, Leanbow, cast a spell and sent the evil warriors into the Underworld, having the Gatekeeper seal the gates for all eternity. The forces of truth successfully thwarted the dark forces' attempt to take the surface world, but they lost Leanbow, as he made sure the evil forces did not escape by sealing himself on their side of the Gate. The human world would never know of the Great Battle, nor of the sacrifices made to spare their lives from destruction. Even to this day they live in peace and tranquility, totally unaware of what is about to awaken.

The city of Briarwood was struck by an earthquake, which was just enough to crack the seal, allowing evil to renew its attempt to invade the human world. The sorceress Udonna, realizing that the forces of evil had returned, sought out the warriors of legend, five teens living in Briarwood, to become the Power Rangers alongside her. While one of the teens was reluctant at first, he realized his destiny and joined the others in the fight against the Master of the Underworld and his numerous minions.

When Udonna loses her Ranger powers to the mysterious Koragg, it is up to Nick, Chip, Madison, Vida, and Xander to save the Earth on their own. They are assisted by Udonna's bumbling apprentice Clare, and eventually Jenji the Genie and his master Daggeron, the Solaris Knight.

Using their powerful magic and incredible martial arts skills, the Mystic Force Power Rangers rely on teamwork to hold back the forces of evil.

"To protect their families, the members of the Power Rangers sent all of their immediate families to this dimension." said mom releasing you. "Here, they will remain safe as your grandmother, the head witch, and the Mystic Mother, the head witch in Nick's world, are the only two who can open the portal between the two worlds."

"This Octomus sounds like a real problem." you said. "Let me come with you, my chaotic science should come in handy and give that villain a real nasty surprise."

Nick looked at you for a moment, then replied...
1543321212.title: To protect ones family.

15433212121.content: you sure about this Mat it's dangerous? Nick asks, i'm sure you say, mom is it ok? you ask, it's your decision Mat mom says, thanks you say, let's go you say, right Nick says.........
15433212121.title: Let's go.

154332121211.content:
Upon arriving in Briarwood, Nick received a communique from Sensei on his wrist mounted unit. "You must come to the shrine with your friend." he said. "It is urgent."

"We're on our way, Sensei." replied Nick. he turned to you. "Sensei is out leader, his appearance may surprise you."

"I deal with insanely advanced science." you told Nick. "Nothing can surprise me."

Minutes later, you were in the shrine with Nick where you met Sensei. You had to admit, you did not expect to find an intelligent rodent but you were not about to say it out loud.

"It was a mistake for you to bring Mat here, Nick." scolded Sensei. "You see, Mat has a power here as well."

"Yes, his chaotic science." said Nick. "I told him it was dangerous to fight the villains we face..."

"It is not his chaotic science that concerns me, Nick." said Sensei. "You see, long ago, there was an evil ranger, the green ranger. This ranger was brainwashed by a villain known as Rita Repulsa. The original Power Rangers Team, lead by the mighty and wise Zordon, eventually helped the green ranger break free of Rita's control and he turned good."

"Only, thanks to a new villain, Lord Zed, Tommy, a.k.a. the green ranger, lost his powers." said Nick. "Later, Zordon gave Tommy a new ranger persona, the white ranger."

Sensei nodded. "Correct." he said. "However, Lord Zed later cloned Tommy and resurrected the green ranger. Tommy and his clone fought each other. Only, during a mission into the past, 1800s, the clone was freed from Lord Zed's control and he decided to stay there." Sensei paused. "Where they were was not the past of this world but the other."

"What... What name did Tommy's clone take on when he decided to stay?" asked Nick.

Sensei took a breath. "Tom Green Cutie."

Your eyes bugged out in shock. "That was my great grandfather!" you exclaimed.

Sensei nodded. "Yes, Mat." he said. "You are the next boy in line to claim the power of the original Green Ranger Only, due to the fact that we already have a green ranger, I would dub you the Dragon Ranger as you would have power over the Dragon Zord, still sleeping at the bottom of the ocean."

"That is so cool!" said Nick, excited. "The legendary Dragon Zord will be a great help!"

"Control yourself, Nick!" scolded Sensei. "There is a catch to obtaining the power of the 'Dragon Ranger'."

"What is that?" you asked.

"If you accept the power, you will be rapped in this world until peace is restored, which could take years." replied Sensei, seriously. "If you choose to return home, you will not be able to return until peace here is restored, nor will I allow Nick to go looking for you again." he paused eying his pupil. "The choice is yours."

What do you choose?
154332121211.title: in briarwood

1543321212112.content: like i would let a world be in trouble i'm staying but can i tell my family bye and call a good friend? you ask, ok sensei says you tell your family bye and call your friend Jake he's 12 like Nick. he's pirate red you say he can become any ranger from the past i'm willing to help since i couldn't stop the great war but i'll help save this world, ok sensei says.......
1543321212112.title: Become the Dragon Ranger.

154332122.content:
You immediately shook your head. "I won't duel her, mom!" you said, firmly. "It would not be a fair match up as I have a year of training against her, what, a few weeks, at most?"

"One month." said Sarah, slightly down cast. "I can change you into a girl and back, fire off energy blasts, and make a few potions but that's all I know how to do right now."

Mom was inwardly pleased that you did not want to take advantage of your little sister's lack of experience but she still had to reward her for her good behavior. "I see." she said, softly. "How about you be Sarah's little cousin, just until we all sit down for dinner?" she smiled. "That way, Sarah will have a playmate for a few hours and you will be left alone the rest of the night, as Mat."

You sighed, sensing that you were not going to win. "Fine." you said, rolling your eyes. "But I should get rewarded too."

"He has a point, Hannah." said Natalie, serious. "He is willing to play along and he will be facing at least a month as Mary through all of this."

Hannah nodded. "You are right, Mat." she said. "You do deserve a reward for being such a good sport. I will allow you to either learn what it is like to be a twin to a witch, as your uncle John was, or an extra little surprise on your birthday next week."

Natalie hid her grin well, knowing what Hannah might have in mind as a 'surprise' but she was concerned about you becoming a twin to a witch as your powers were greater than Sarah's. "Hannah may end up transforming Sarah instead if Mat choses to be her twin." she thought. "I just hope she's ready to deal with a hysterical 'Seth'."

What do you chose?
154332122.title: You refuse.

1543321222.content:
You moaned. "Hologram John warned me about the twin factor." you said. "No thank you., I'll take the extra surprise on my birthday and I hope its not something that will make me a girl again, I will have had my fill of it by then."

Mom hid her disappointment well. "It'll be something you'll like." she said. "I promise." then she thought, "Now I just have to think of what it could be."

"Okay, who's going to make me Mary until dinner?" you asked.

"It would be best if I do that." said mom. "We don't want any accidents."

"Please let me do it mom." begged Sarah. "I promise I'll be careful and, if I mess up, he can always change himself back with his whatchamacallits."

Mom giggled while Natalie smiled, both shaking their heads. "It's pseudo magic, Sarah." corrected mom. "Or, as the boys call it, chaotic science."

"Whatever, can I do it, mom... please?" asked Sarah.

Mom sighed then turned to Natalie. "What do you think?"

Natalie shook her head. "I'd advise against Sarah trying, she's too young but I can not make that decision for you."

Mom nodded then turned back to Sarah and said...
1543321222.title: The extra birthday surprise.

15433212222.content: Sure Sarah but becareful mom said, I will Sarah says. You feel yourself becoming a 7 year old girl, How do you feel Mary? mom asks. I feel ok but I'm only staying like this for one month you say, Okay and you'll get your surprise mom says. "shall we go on through your month as Mary? or skip to when you get your surprise?"
15433212222.title: Okay, but be careful.
